metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17440 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
GNU Libextractor 1.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via a crafted GIF, IT (Impulse Tracker), NSFE, S3M (Scream Tracker 3), SID, or XM (eXtended Module) file, as demonstrated by the EXTRACTOR_xm_extract_method function in plugins/xm_extractor.c. It was discovered tha Libextractor incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17440` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

extract - 1:1.6-2
libextractor3 - 1:1.6-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libextractor package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.6-2').
